intro: Hydrostachys hildebrandtii f. boinensis, commonly known as the Boinensis hydrostachys, is a rare and delicate plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in wet, marshy environments, thriving in humid and shaded conditions. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in spikelets, a common feature among sedges. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
